string-array.name: tutorial_descriptions
string-array.item: Get outside! Find something wild, and take a clear, full frame photo.
Check back for comments and identifications on your observation!
Research Grade observations are shared with scientists working to better understand and protect nature.

resources.string: Are you sure you want to sign out? This will delete all your observations on this device. It will not affect any observations you\'ve uploaded to iNaturalist.
უკაცრავად, ამ წყაროდან ფოტოს ჩატვირთვისას შეცდომა მოხდა
The main iNaturalist Network. Clicking OK will set your app as part of the global iNaturalist network.
iNaturalist is a member of the iNaturalist Network in Mexico. Would you like to use this network to localize your experience and share data accordingly?
NatureWatch NZ is a member of the iNaturalist Network in New Zealand. Would you like to use this network to localize your experience and share data accordingly?
iNaturalist Canada is a member of the iNaturalist Network in Canada. Would you like to use this network to localize your experience and share data accordingly?
Naturalista is a member of the iNaturalist Network in Colombia. Would you like to use this network to localize your experience and share data accordingly?
Biodiversity4all is a member of the iNaturalist Network in Portugal. Would you like to use this network to localize your experience and share data accordingly?

The Internet connection appears to be offline.
Could not retrieve the guide details - probably a network error.
Yes, license my content so scientists can use my data. Learn More

Check this box if you want to apply a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial license to your photos. You can choose a different license or remove the license later, but this is the best license for sharing with researchers.
შესული უნდა იყოთ, რომ ნახოთ თქვენი მეგზურები.
შესული უნდა იყოთ, რომ ნახოთ თქვენი განახლებები.
iNaturalist-ის გამოყენებით თქვენ ეთანხმებით მოხმარების პირობებს და კონფიდენციალურობის პოლიტიკას
Turn on Auto-Sync in Settings and your observations will be automatically uploaded to iNaturalist.
Add a location to advance this observation to “Needs ID” status.
Add a date to advance this observation to “Needs ID” status.
Add a photo to advance this observation to “Needs ID” status.
Observation is casual grade because it is captive/cultivated.
Observation needs more identifications from the community to become "Research Grade" status.

Geoprivacy is a setting you can make on your observations that controls how the spatial coordinates (latitude and longitude) are displayed. Here are the options:
open - Everyone can see the coordinates unless the taxon is threatened.
obscured - Public coordinates shown as a random point within a 0.2 by 0.2 degree area that contains the true coordinates, which works out to about a 22x22 km square area of uncertainty at the equator, decreasing as you approach the poles. True coordinates are only visible to you and the curators of projects to which you add the observation.
private - Coordinates completely hidden from public maps, true coordinates only visible to you and the curators of projects to which you add the observation.

Note that curators of individual projects can always see the coordinates regardless of your geoprivacy setting, so if you are concerned about who has access to the coordinates you should be sure you trust the curators of the projects in which you participate.
Are you sure you want to withdraw this identification?
Be the first to fave this observation...
Leave a comment or suggest an identification...
Log In or Sign Up to leave a comment or suggest an identification...
Log In or Sign Up to see faves or fave this observation...

Sync this observation in order to leave a comment or suggest an identification...
Are you sure you want to flag this observation as captive/cultivated? (Pressing yes will also close the observation viewer window)
Do you agree to the following?

Auto-upload new observations and edits to observations
The iNaturalist Network is a framework for localizing the iNaturalist community on national scales. Such national focus can help make nature more accessible to people of different backgrounds.
დაასახეთ რა დაინახეთ, მაგრამ არაუშავს თუ არ შეგიძლიათ. შეიძლება სხვებმა დაგეხმარონ ამოცნობაში!
Check back soon for identifications and comments on your observation(s).
Import multiple photos by long-pressing on a single photo
Looks like there’s no recommendations in this area. Try moving to a new location.
Missions are realtime recommendations of what to look for around you. This way you can discover species new to you! (Requires connectivity)
Could not download latest observations - Connection problems. Try again later.
განახლება ჯერ არ არის. ხაზზე იყავით!
(You will only receive updates once you\'ve created observations)
(You will only receive updates once you\'re following observations)

It looks like you deleted a photo by clearing the app cache before uploading. You will need to add the photo back to your observation from your gallery. In the future, please make sure you have uploaded all your photos before clearing the app cache.

These are links to ancestors of this particular taxon. They are in order from coarser to more refined. Use these links to move up and down the Tree of Life. For example, if you don\'t know what an organism is, but know what grouping it falls into, tap on a taxon from the list to view more information about it.
საკმარისად დარწმუნებული არ ვართ რეკომენდაცი რომ მოგცეთ, მაგრამ ეს არის ჩვენი პირველი %1$d ვარაუდი:
We\'re pretty sure it\'s in this %1$s:
Suggest species based on visual similarity to photos.
შეცდომა ფოტო(ები)ს იმპორტისას: მხოლოდ შემდეგი ფორმატის ფოტოების იმპორტია შესაძლებელი – JPG/JPEG/PNG
Please select a valid taxon from the list (or clear the taxon field).
The location or place you have searched is not in our database. Please choose a place from the list of options below the location search field or clear the search field.
Track identifications you suggest for observations by other people here.
This is a list of the species you have observed the most.\n\nFYI: There\'s an estimated 9 million species on the planet, so get out there and observe them!
Observations are records of your encounters with individual organisms at particular times and locations.
Is the evidence provided enough to confirm this is %1$s?
არ ვიცი, მაგრამ მგონი ეს არის %1$s.
No, but it is a member of %1$s.
You must be connected to the Internet to load more observations
iNaturalist is a joint initiative by the California Academy of Sciences and the National Geographic Society.

iNaturalist is made by every single person who participates in our community. The people who build the software, maintain our infrastructure, and foster collaborations are Amanda Bullington, Yaron Budowski, Tony Iwane, Patrick Leary, Scott Loarie, Abhas Misraraj, Alex Shepard, Carrie Seltzer, and Ken-ichi Ueda (our former designer Joelle Belmonte designed much of the current Android app). Caltech and Cornell University helped develop the computer vision system that recognizes species from photographs. We thank Grant Van Horn, Serge Belongie, and Pietro Perona for this work. More information may be found at visipedia.org
The password the app uses no longer works - did you change your password on the website? Please enter the new one here

Google requires us to ask for permission to access your contacts in order to use your Google Account, even though we do not access your contacts for any reason. If you deny this permission, you will need to sign up or login with a username and password.
